title: Sellafield
summary: Sellafield is a large multi-function nuclear site close to Seascale on the coast of Cumbria, England. As of August 2020, activities at the site include nuclear fuel reprocessing, nuclear waste storage and nuclear decommissioning, and it is a former nuclear power generating site. The licensed site covers an area of 265 hectares (650 acres),[1] and comprises more than 200 nuclear facilities and more than 1,000 buildings.[2] It is Europe's largest nuclear site and has the most diverse range of nuclear facilities in the world situated on a single site.[3]
